text:
Patient w/ recent hx of ERCP; Had an elective lap chole on [**1-22**] at
   [**Hospital **] [**Hospital **] Hospital and post op was admitted to the floor; on
   POD #1 pt had increasing abdominal pain, became hypotensive with
   decreased uop. Patient taken back to the OR for an ex lap- found a
   cystic stump leak from clips falling off postop; her small bowel was
   also dusky and she underwent a SBR;; patient was transferred to TSICU
   for further management of care on [**1-24**]. aggressive resuscitation,
   triple pressures then returned to OR that night where more ischemic
   bowel was found and a transverse colectomy was preformed.  Pt taken
   back to OR [**1-25**] for resection of terminal ileum, ascending, transverse
   colon and upper portion of the sigmoid colon. [**1-26**] pt back to OR for a
   resection of bowel anastamosis, reanastamosis, ileostomy, bilat
   oophorectomy, salpingectomy, partial hysterectomy, [**State **] patch,
   g-tube, and J-tube. [**1-27**] started on CVVH. CVVH was stopped [**1-29**] due to
   persistent hypotension
   Sepsis, Severe (with organ dysfunction)
   Assessment:
   +blood cultures for yeast
   Abdomen firm, open, absent BS,  abdominal [**Doctor Last Name **] drains put out large
   amnt secretions,
   SBP >90
   Black tongue
   Large amnt of oozing from every skin breakdown
   Low platelets
   Pt withdraws to pain, grimaced to pain/suctioning, does not open eyes,
   poor gag/cough,
   Large NGT output, absent BS, abd firm/open. Less output from G-tube
   Action:
   Off Levophed last night at [**2122**]
   Got 1 unit of platlets  transfused overnight
   [**Last Name (un) 3864**] monitoring is ongoing(team aware that Pt is in a/fib and this
   might impact [**Last Name (un) 13380**] accuracy)
   Pt was blood cultured last night
   Remains on meropenum, vanco, cipro and micafungin
   Treated with fentanyl for pain
   Response:
   SVV 18-24, SBP >90, normothermic, warm feet, + pulses, tongue remains
   black, PLT count up to >80
   Plan:
   Cont antibiotics, hemodynamics monitoring,
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   Intubated day 5. Remains on a/c with 10 peep, LS with
   rhonchi/diminished
   Action:
   VAP care, monitoring ABGs, self rotating bed, unable to obtain RSBI due
   to PEEP
   Response:
   No changed in vent settings, ABG wnl
   Plan:
   Full vent support
   [**Last Name **] Problem
 alteration skin integrity
   Assessment:
   Pt has multiple puncture wounds that leaking as well as many
   blisters-some of which have bursted.
   Mepeflex dsg on coccyx intact,
   open abdomen with clear dsg on and JP/[**Doctor Last Name **] drains intact,
   Action:
   Skin care, rotating bed, central lipid TPN is ongoing
   Response:
   Less drainage from R. groin bag, c.line dsdg was changed twice
   Plan:
   keep pt
s skin dry, frequent skin care
   Renal failure, acute (Acute renal failure, ARF)
   Assessment:
   Creat >2.1-up from 1.9 yeasterday, lactate 5 today-up from 4.7
   Action:
   CVVHDF off yesterday.
   Response:
   Worsening renal picture while off CVVHDf
   Plan:
   Consult with renal team, monitor I/O, replete lytes as needed
   Atrial fibrillation (Afib)
   Assessment:
   Pt remains in A/fib, 85-100 rate, irregular.
   Action:
   Amioderone gtt ongoing at 0.5mg /min
   Response:
   No changes in rate
   Plan:
   Consider cardioversion
